quest.name: On the Eve of Destiny
journal: Hien understands what he must do for Doma.
objectives: Speak with Alphinaud at the House of the Fierce.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: The Dairyu Moon Gates have guarded the approach to Doma Castle since long before the imperial occupation.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: We do not anticipate any great difficulty in gaining entry to the gatehouse as our Doman friends know its every nook and cranny. The challenge will come in preserving the element of surprise. But I am confident the shinobi will rise to the occasion.

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: Oh, there you are. I saw you leave with Lord Hien earlier. Where is he?

dialogue.name: YUGIRI
dialogue.text: During the rebellion, the imperials turned to their agents among the shinobi, and through their treachery were many of my comrades slaughtered.

dialogue.name: YUGIRI
dialogue.text: We few who survived have not forgotten that day. The memory of it has spurred us never to neglect our training, that we might be ready to administer revenge.

dialogue.name: HIEN
dialogue.text: On second thought, Forename, I ask that you return to the House of the Fierce without me, and tell Alphinaud to call the others together for a meeting.

dialogue.name: HIEN
dialogue.text: It is imperative that the Kojin emissary be in attendance as well. I shall join you anon.

dialogue.name: HIEN
dialogue.text: Do not worry, my friend. I will not be far behind.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: Lord Hien wishes to discuss the details of our plan? Very well, if he insists. I shall summon the others at once.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: As for the Kojin, I believe one of their emissaries was already en route. Nevertheless, I shall contact them to make certain.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: It is...unorthodox, but I am in no position to speak against it.

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: We are fast approaching that moment when all is in order and we have naught to do but wait...frustrating as it is. <sigh> Well, when the time comes, I wish you the best of luck. Oh, and remember: no noble sacrifices or anything similarly stupid.

dialogue.name: HIEN
dialogue.text: Thank you for accompanying me earlier. 'Twas in that moment of clarity that I understood what we needed to do.

dialogue.name: HANAME
dialogue.text: We are to flood the castle, then... So be it. I will inform the Xaela.

dialogue.name: KAIDATE
dialogue.text: Lord Hien may be young, but none among us question his leadership! We will defend him and his people to the last!

dialogue.name: MOTOJIRO
dialogue.text: Mayhap it is for the best. According to our spies in the castle, they do strange and terrible things in the lowest levels. Experiments involving men and magitek. If we can destroy their work before our forces enter the castle...

dialogue.name: YAGORO
dialogue.text: My lord and his comrades are an inspiration. To spur our countrymen to rise up once more within a year of our defeat is a feat no others could accomplish.

dialogue.name: LYSE
dialogue.text: If there's nothing else, I'll head back to Namai. Tsuranuki's working hard, and Isse's doing what he can to help, but maybe there's more that I can do too.

dialogue.name: LYSE
dialogue.text: He was like a different person when he began hammering those plates. Younger, brighter, full of life and hope...

dialogue.name: YUGIRI
dialogue.text: No plan is perfect, and there is ever room for improvement. I expect my comrades will be refining their approach until the moment they begin.

dialogue.name: YUGIRI
dialogue.text: In case you are unaware, the other jonin will lead the assault on the Moon Gates, not I. My place is at Lord Hien's side.

dialogue.name: YUGIRI
dialogue.text: That my lord saw fit to let me accompany him came as a relief. There is nowhere I would rather be than by his side when the fighting begins.

dialogue.name: GOSETSU
dialogue.text: The plan is set, and all that can be done has been done. Rest and relaxation are now paramount, for tomorrow we may die.

dialogue.name: GOSETSU
dialogue.text: Have you too not done enough? Will you not pause a moment to gather yourself on the eve of our grand design? Go not unto battle with weary eyes or lingering regrets, my friend.

dialogue.name: GOSETSU
dialogue.text: Ere you go to war, savor peace, for you may never know it again.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: Soroban informs me that his sappers will be ready within the day, which means that we can proceed as planned and attack Doma Castle tomorrow.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: Considering the key role you will play, I think it only prudent that you refrain from further labors and rest until tomorrow. Agreed?

dialogue.name: Q1
dialogue.text: What will you say?

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: Far be it from me to refuse...

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: No rest for the righteous!

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: We shall speak again in the morning. Take care, my friend...

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: True enough, true enough. When you have seen to your sundry tasks and are ready to retire, I pray you let me know.
